intro: Euonymus timorensis, commonly known as the Timor beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Cercidiphyllaceae and is characterized by its striking, red-purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants.
